title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include either of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes the first criterion below, but not the second.
The response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. The response must both state that real interest rates will increase and explain why in order to earn the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that real interest rates will increase and/or does not explain that an increase in government spending will increase the demand for loanable funds (or the decrease in taxes will decrease the supply of loanable funds), which will increase real interest rates in Canada.

The response states that real interest rates will increase and explains that an increase in government spending will increase the demand for loanable funds (or the decrease in taxes will decrease the supply of loanable funds), which will increase real interest rates in Canada.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. The response should be consistent with the change in real interest rates identified in part (b).
descriptions: The response does not state that financial capital flows to Canada will increase.
The response states that financial capital flows to Canada will increase.

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include either of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes the first criterion below, but not the second.
The response accurately includes both criteria below.

title: Part (e)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response should be consistent with the change in the exchange rate shown in part (d).
descriptions: The response does not state that the international value of the Norwegian krone will decrease, or the krone will depreciate.
The response states that the international value of the Norwegian krone will decrease, or the krone will depreciate.

title: Part (f)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response should be consistent with the change in the international value of the Norwegian krone identified in part (e).

The response must both state that Norway’s current account will be in surplus and explain why in order to earn the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that Norway’s current account will be in surplus and/or does not explain that the depreciation of the Norwegian krone will make Norwegian goods become relatively cheaper to Canadian buyers, which increases Norwegian exports, and Canadian goods will become relatively more expensive to Norwegian buyers, which decreases Norwegian imports.

The response states that Norway’s current account will be in surplus and explains that the depreciation of the Norwegian krone will make Norwegian goods become relatively cheaper to Canadian buyers, which increases Norwegian exports, and Canadian goods will become relatively more expensive to Norwegian buyers, which decreases Norwegian imports.

title: Part (g)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response should be consistent with the change in the exchange rate shown in part (d).
descriptions: The response does not state that Canada’s net exports will decrease.
The response does state that Canada’s net exports will decrease.

title: Part (h)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response should be consistent with the change in net exports identified in part (g).
